description: Single storey rear extension; replacement of door with window to rear elevation; alterations to existing retractable sunscreen to rear wall of dwelling
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): 077.SA 04 Rev A, 077.SA 05 Rev A, 077.SA 06 Rev A, received 07.09.2023
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing dwellinghouse on site.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The hereby approved two rooflights to the roof slope of the hereby approved development shall not project more than 150mm from the plane of the roof slope when measured perpendicularly and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7B, 7.4 & 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| The proposed ^IN; on the side elevations shall contain only obscure glass and only have top openings at a minimum of 1.7m from floor level.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), policies policy 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012).
